Output specification

What “board-ready Trust Ledger output” means: what is delivered, how it is structured, and how acceptance is assessed.

Request via Gate Trust Ledger Vendor pack
Primary deliverables

Delivered as versioned artefacts. Evidence links are explicit. Missing proofs are listed as gaps.

Board memo (PDF)

  • Executive summary (decision + rationale)
  • Decision options and tradeoffs
  • Actions, owners, timelines
  • Scope, exclusions, assumptions

Trust Ledger snapshot

  • Use case / system identifiers
  • Owners and approvers (by role)
  • Controls and evidence pointers
  • Gaps and follow-ups

Controls map

  • Risks ↔ controls ↔ proof linkage
  • Effectiveness notes (evidence-based)
  • Prioritized remediation actions

Evidence index

  • Reviewed artefacts
  • Missing evidence list
  • Assumptions register
Acceptance criteria
  • Scope clarity and explicit exclusions
  • Ownership clarity (accountable roles)
  • Evidence linkage (or explicit assumptions)
  • Actionability (clear next steps)
  • Board readability (executive summary stands alone)
Scope boundaries
  • Not legal representation; internal counsel retains final positions
  • Not forensic pentesting; evidence-based review within agreed access
  • Public intake is non-confidential by design
